channel.title: Docs on David Ferris
channel.description: Recent content in Docs on David Ferris

item.title: About Me
item.description: About Me # I am a software engineer and entrepreneur from Toronto, Canada. I studied mechatronics engineering at the University of Waterloo and founded phonic.ai. Elsewhere # daveferbear on Github

item.title: Bookshelf
item.description: Bookshelf # Biographies & Autobiographies # Disturbing the Universe by Freeman Dyson Steve Jobs by Walter Isaacson Einstein: His Life and Universe by Walter Isaacson Math & Science # The Information: A History, a Theory, a Flood by James Gleick Chaos: Making a New Science by James Gleick The Signal and the Noise by Nate Silver The Master Algorithm by Pedro Domingos Superintelligence: Paths, Dangers, Strategies by Nick Bostrom Nudge by Richard Thaler and Cass Sunstein The Road to Reality by Roger Penrose Incerto (Series) by Nassim Taleb Lost in Math by Sabine Hossenfelder The Alchemy of Air: A Jewish Genius, a Doomed Tycoon, and the Scientific Discovery That Fed the World but Fueled the Rise of Hitler by Thomas Hager Technology + Culture # The Age of Surveillance Capitalism by Shoshana Zuboff World Without Mind by Franklin Foer Secrets of Sandhill Road by Scott Kupor The Innovator’s Dilemna by Clayton Christensen Maximum City by Suketu Mehta Winners Take All: The Elite Charade of Changing the World by Anand Giridharadas Textbooks # C++ Primer (5th Edition) by Stanley B.
